DataElement.preferredName: Gastric Intestinal Type Adenocarcinoma Predominant Subtype WHO Criterion Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the predominant subtype of stomach intestinal adenocarcinoma using WHO criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gastric Intestinal Type Adenocarcinoma Predominant WHO Criterion Subtype
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.  Grossly, it tends to be nodular, polypoid or ulcerated._Most important; principal._A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services._Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated._A group forming a type within a larger type.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.  Grossly, it tends to be nodular, polypoid or ulcerated.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.

Property.preferredName: Main World Health Organization Criterion Subtype
Property.preferredDefinition: Most important; principal.:A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.:Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.:A group forming a type within a larger type.

Concepts.definition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.
A group forming a type within a larger type.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Stomach EPC form per request by J.Demchok. mc 4/12/13

ValueDomain.preferredName: Gastric Intestinal Adenocarcinoma WHO Criterion Sub Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things._An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.  Grossly, it tends to be nodular, polypoid or ulcerated._A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Otherwise Specified Gastric Intestinal Type Adenocarcinoma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Otherwise Specified Gastric Intestinal Type Adenocarcinoma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.  Grossly, it tends to be nodular, polypoid or ulcerated.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant of gastric adenocarcinoma with more than half of the tumor containing extracellular mucinous pools.

Concepts.definition: A variant of gastric adenocarcinoma with more than half of the tumor containing extracellular mucinous pools.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant of gastric adenocarcinoma with exophytic growth and elongated finger-like processes lined by cylindrical or cuboidal cells supported by fibrovascular connective tissue cores.

Concepts.definition: A variant of gastric adenocarcinoma with exophytic growth and elongated finger-like processes lined by cylindrical or cuboidal cells supported by fibrovascular connective tissue cores.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant of gastric adenocarcinoma characterized by prominent dilated or slit-like tubules.

Concepts.definition: A variant of gastric adenocarcinoma characterized by prominent dilated or slit-like tubules.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
